results.title: Dance crazy in Hollywood
results.creator_credit: RM Arts, Clara Films, Gerard Paquet and Robert Kuperberg
results.brief_description: A collection of cinematic excerpts along with interviews with Hermes Pan, choreographer extraordinaire who created many of the most memorable musical dance moments in the era of the major Hollywood musicals. The film is a biographical study of Pan’s entry into the world of dance, his arrival in Hollywood, and his work with a variety of filmmakers, actors and dancers. Ultimately, it is also a tribute to his contribution to musical film history as the documentary was completed very shortly before his death. Also featuring discussion about and footage of dance greats such as Fred Astaire, Ginger Rogers, Rita Hayworth, Kim Novak, Bob Fosse, Ann Miller, Carol Haney, Elizabeth Taylor, Cyd Charisse and Hermes Pan himself in rare motion picture appearances, the documentary is a personalised insight into the Hollywood musical era with reflective commentary from Pan in the presentation of its archival contents.

results.title: Damsels be damned
results.brief_description: A fantastic fairytale, with the ambivalence and logic of a dream. Deals with the difference between the fairy tale stereotype of women as beautiful princesses awaiting their prince charmings and the real world of male and female relationships. “Damsels Be Damned” entwines fantasy, fiction and reality. Offbeat and amusing it plunges below the surface of sexual stereotypes to the darkness of sexual assault.

results.title: Damned whores and evil bitches: prostitution in Australia 1788-1988
results.creator_credit: Rosa Colosimo Productions and Rosa Colosimo
results.brief_description: Australia’s founding mothers arrived in 1788 and their legacy continues to thrive as a multi million dollar industry. A revealing expose of prostitution, the oldest profession, from colonial to modern times and its impact on Australian society through dramatic re-enactments, archival material, contemporary footage and interviews. Narrated by Tracy Harvey.
results.title_for_label: Damned whores and evil bitches: prostitution in Australia 1788-1988

results.title: Damn it. B.Y.O.
results.brief_description: 1. “Damn it” (Sweden, 1980, 20 min.): An animated film showing the physical and emotional stresses experienced by a young man in a big city. 2. “BYO” (Brisbane, 1980, 19 min.): A dramatisation of a school dance where smuggling alcohol causes more trouble than it’s worth.

results.title: Dame Kiri Te Kanawa: my world of opera
results.brief_description: Dame Kiri Te Kanawa introduces a personal selection of her own favourite operatic scenes recorded at some of the world’s major venues and shares with viewers her recollections of memorable performances from the world of opera. Featured are: Thomas Allen, Vladimir Atlantov, Janet Baker, Barbara Bonney, Jose Carreras, Ileana Cotrubas, Placido Domingo, Mirella Freni, Robert Lloyd and Neil Shicoff. The venues cover the plush and gilt interior of the Royal Opera House Covent Garden, the magnificent Teatro alla Scala, Milan and Arena di Verona, and the more intimate surroundings of Glyndebourne where Opera and picturesque English countryside make for a pleasant harmony. Sumptuous costumes, glimmering jewels, spectacular sets and spine tingling song all add up to an unforgettable experience. Dame Kiri relates some of the experiences she has encountered as an opera singer. Placido Domingo demonstrates his versatility when he conducts the orchestra in a performance of Die Fledermaus and also provides the occasion for some comic relief. Included are excerpts from the following operas: Der Rosenkavalier, The Tales of Hoffman, Don Carlo, La Boheme, Die Fledermaus, Ernani, Andrea Chenier, Nabucco, Otello, La Cenerentola, and Orfeo ed Euridice.
